data.title: Primary indices
data.solution:
""" Ungolfed and explained:

n = int(input()) # Getting the input
constant = "0." # The beginning if the constant

for i in range(2, 5**6): # Generating enough terms (we need more than 10,000 for the last one)
    if all(i%e != 0 for e in range(2, i)): # Checking if number is prime
           constant += str(i) # If yes, add it to the constant

print(constant[n]) # Printing what is found at index N"""



# My attempt to golf:
print(("0."+"".join(str(i)for i in range(2,5**6)if all(i%e!=0 for e in range(2,i))))[int(input())])
data.statement:
The <<Copeland–Erdős constant>> is the concatenation of "0." with the base 10 representations of the prime numbers in order. Its value is approximately <<0.235711131719232931374143...>>.
The goal is to output the digit (in the range of {{0}} to {{9}} included) at indice [[N]]. Be careful, do not forget the decimal point.

<<Important note:>> In this exercice, the period representing the floating number is not omitted. Therefore, the first 2 is found at index {{2}} and index 1 is {{.}}.
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] representing the desired index.
data.outputDescription:
You must output the [[N]] indice of the <<Copeland–Erdős constant>>. Be careful, do not forget the decimal point.

<<Line 1:>> The digit found at the position [[N]] of the <<Copeland–Erdős constant>>.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

The Copeland–Erdős constant is the concatenation of "0." with the base 10 representations of the prime numbers in order. Its value is approximately 0.235711131719232931374143....
The goal is to output the digit (in the range of 0 to 9 included) at indice N. Be careful, do not forget the decimal point.

Important note: In this exercice, the period representing the floating number is not omitted. Therefore, the first 2 is found at index 2 and index 1 is ..
Input
Line 1: An integer N representing the desired index.
Output
You must output the N indice of the Copeland–Erdős constant. Be careful, do not forget the decimal point.

Line 1: The digit found at the position N of the Copeland–Erdős constant.
Constraints
0 ≤ N ≤ 4722
Example
Input
5
Output
7
